593310039.name: Unexpected upscale art gallery with broad selection of local and international artists
593310039.author: a TripAdvisor user
593310039.reviewBody: You must stop and see this lovely gallery! It carries a broad selection of paintings, artifacts, wovens , sculptures and more from local and internationally known artisans.

591830156.name: Lost money
591830156.author: a TripAdvisor user
591830156.reviewBody: Very little to offer.  Disappointing but I saved money by not staying long.  Too bad it does not have more to offer

address.streetAddress: Av. Mar de Cortes Sur, Verdugo

590219768.name: A small place to gamble for a few minutes
590219768.author: a TripAdvisor user
590219768.reviewBody: This is a very smal casino with just a few machines. Usually crowded, and terribly smelling of cigaretts, Still if you need a few moments of excitement and have money to waste - this is one of the options!

address.streetAddress: Av. Mar de Cortes Sur, Verdugo

437858815.name: MINI-CASINO, NIGHT CLUB AND HANGOUT SPOT - ON THE BEACH
437858815.author: a TripAdvisor user
437858815.reviewBody: Located at on Avenida Mar de Cortez, within walking distance (half mile) south of downtown San Felipe, the WINCLUB CASINO housed in a small non-descript building adjacent to the Hotel Costa Azul is a miniature casino, nightclub and great daytime and nighttime (3:00 am) hangout for Mexican locals and foreign tourists. The mostly smoke-free casino (with smokers\u2019 area in the rear) offers gambling on sporting events--like; horse racing, soccer, football, and basketball. The secure, clean, and modern casino offers a variety of slot machines (in English and Spanish) plus a full-service bar that provides small meals from a limited menu, plus bottled beer ($1.50).

address.streetAddress: Av. Mar de Cortes Sur, Verdugo

666096443.name: Spring Break Wild  Bar
666096443.author: a TripAdvisor user
666096443.reviewBody: This place is legendary as a party bar in San Felipe.  It\'s vibe is mainly for college age kids. A wild time can be had at this place.

364021325.name: Rockodile!
364021325.author: a TripAdvisor user
364021325.reviewBody: This place was Jumpin\' wall to wall girls for you single guys out there!\nAnd it was hotter than hell inside. However, it is the place to be while in San Felipe!

316567776.name: We were told to go and we did.
316567776.author: a TripAdvisor user
316567776.reviewBody: What a great idea! We were told to go for some nightlife bar action. It was great. They don\'t sell bottles of water but plenty of Tecate ($3) and lots of great music! We danced all night two nights in a row. If you look on the walls however....you can tell what kind of events may have occurred in the past. You\'ll laugh. Great local spot

276879934.name: Dance Freely Here!
276879934.author: a TripAdvisor user
276879934.reviewBody: My girlfriends and I decided we needed a ladies trip so we headed down to San Felipe as we\'ve been before and just love it. Came here on Friday night, got a tower drink and danced for hours; just had a blast. Always a good time here!

216905743.name: Great place (very americanized)
216905743.author: a TripAdvisor user
216905743.reviewBody: This is a great place very similar to papas and beer we where there the Waste of the canelo fight  drinks where $2.50 you cant beat that it was great i will go back for sure really enjoyed the time and you wont spend so much money for the quality of party you will get

211020811.name: Awesome!!
211020811.author: a TripAdvisor user
211020811.reviewBody: This is a great place to party had a BLAST!! Came back after 10 years and look forward to returning next year! \ud83d\ude0d

1711310.name: My kinda town
1711310.author: a TripAdvisor user
1711310.reviewBody: i go to san felipe every year. either during spring break, memorial or labor day weekend. every time i go i have a blast. i stay for 3-4 days at a time and sleep probably 12 hrs the entire time. this place is a great place for any occasion. go for the weeked and party or take your family and fish.

1273269.name: Midnight at Rockadille
1273269.author: a TripAdvisor user
1273269.reviewBody: Rowdy! Fun! but caters to Americans. Not much Mexican influence there. \nAmericans act like they own the place! <San Felipe, I mean>. Wasn\'t impressed with the room rates for off season, but it was nice to have the beaches to our selves. Some Americans at Rockadille were rude to us.

389037.name: Great Place to PARTY!
389037.author: a TripAdvisor user
389037.reviewBody: We visited San Felipe last May for the Memorial Day Weekend. What a n experience. The Rockadile was the place to be at night. Great music, very interesting people and lots of room to dance with two dance floors. The outdoor dancefloor is a basketball court by day. It\'s a blast. Remember to get there early because by 9PM there is a line to get in and you\'ll be out there forever!\nHave fun! Oh and take a marker and a stapler because there is a tradition of writing your name on a dollar bill and stapling it to the ceiling! Cool place!\n

671273905.name: California but not California
671273905.author: a TripAdvisor user
671273905.reviewBody:
Growing up in Socal, I can say that San Felipe is very similar to the beaches just above the coastline, but better weather and warmer water temperature  It was quite dirty, littered with trash along the shore, but I cleaned it all up single-handedly with 4 trashbags for about an hour.  After that, the beach was nice and pristine and I was able to enjoy swimming in the relatively calm waters although I missed the waves like in Cali.  

My husband and I visited as a recommendation by our friend who loves it here.  We booked an airbnb for 5 days, about 20 mins walk from the Malecon to experience the local life.  

The highlights of the trip were: 

- El Serape: We got in pretty late in town and starving, but luckily this was open around 10pm full of locals so we knew it had to be good...and it was, the best tacos I've had here yet.

- ATV: We rented an ATV across the LaTaza cafe because it was the cheaper of the 2 ATV rental places.  We had so much fun exploring the dunes, the other parts of town, blasting psytrance on our speaker.  We even found a private beach for a while.

- Mi Compa Mario's fish tacos, Chompa's chillaquilles (The best in town IMO)

- All the friendly dogs running around

- Relatively quiet beach with friendly locals

665142706.name: Beaches with odiferous dead fish.
665142706.author: a TripAdvisor user
665142706.reviewBody: You will find the beaches and side roads around San Felipe littered with the smelly totoava carcusus from night poachers, and other fish remains that have washed up or been discarded. After a visit to a beach here, I doubt you\'ll have the stomach for one of San Felipe\'s famous tacos de pescado. Unless San Felipe does something to prevent poaching and discarding of fish waste close to shore tourism will surely continue to decline. I\'ll note that I\'ve been visiting SF for the past 38 years and feel that the beaches are at an all time low.

591829856.name: South of south beach
591829856.author: a TripAdvisor user
591829856.reviewBody: Try km 30 and above.  Wow.  Pelicans, seals, dolphins, whales, great blue herons, vultures and stray dogs.  Great beach.  Warm and beautiful water.  Great sunrise and sunset\n\nSouth Campos

555486690.name: It can get busy as the day goes on,  mornings are always quiet. Tideal change is amazing
555486690.author: a TripAdvisor user
555486690.reviewBody: Nice beach,  generally clean and not to steep. Surf is steady and often grows through the day but never a problem getting in and out of the warm water. When the tide is out there are huge expanses to explore due to the gentle slope. After all it is a central draw to the towm and malecon.

521508416.name: Nice Beach, Not as Crowded as it Used to be.
521508416.author: a TripAdvisor user
521508416.reviewBody: Many people have told me that this beach was pooping about 10-15 years ago. A lot of spring breakers are starting to chose other areas to go to so this place has fallen a little on reputation. This is a really nice beach with a lot of good places to eat. I love it! Not a lot of people speak english so, nice try! I do speak spanish and I am fluent. But there are also other americans down there as well.

431390439.name: Relaxation at a good price.
431390439.author: a TripAdvisor user
431390439.reviewBody:
Exchange your money in Mexicali. If you spend money its easier to figure out how much you owe.  I used my credit card anywhere I could to avoid carrying cash.  I took 45 cash.   You can bargain shop.
You are going to spend the same as any tourist spot though.  30 for A meal for 4.   Sunglasses about 5.  Sundress for 12.  Tank top for 9.  Pina Colada 7.  
I stayed at Mazatlan campgrounds in South beach.   Campground was cleaned and had running water, showers and bathrooms. No electricity. Went 3rd  weekend of Oct. Weather was in the 90's.  I recommend you dress lightly but take a light sweater for nights.  The water was clean.  The beach was clean.   Saw some fish in the water.    Beach was filled with large beach rocks and seashells so  take some water shoes.   At the Malecon went to a restaurant and did some shopping.  
My advice: Watch your belongings like you do at any tourist spot.  Watch your surroundings like you would any place outside U.S.  Coming home - Leave early on Sunday or Monday so you don't wait long at the u.s.border crossing. I turned my data off when I crossed the border.  I have at&t and I would need to change plans to use service or pay crazy fees.  I was traveling with other family members that had good service. No service at the beach. We traveled in caravans and used walkie talkies.  Someone in our group had a head injury and we were able to get help for him in town - he was back in 2 hrs with17 stitches.   I will be going back for sure next year.

399348183.name: Nice to look, don\'t swim in it!
399348183.author: a TripAdvisor user
399348183.reviewBody: Beautiful from a distance and great for jogging or strolling. The "sand" is muddy....muddy ocean floor, muddy everything. Some places you sink to your ankles in mud.. Got some pretty shells at low tide, and enjoyed watching the thousands of birds, however had to be mindful of the pools of bird droppings everywhere .

366073142.name: Great small town Mexico experience
366073142.author: a TripAdvisor user
366073142.reviewBody: I\'ve been going to San Felipe for over 40 years but about 7 yrs ago, I swore it off because I saw it as another dirty unsafe town south of the border. As a turn of fairness, we went for a week in April 2016 to see how things changed. Very much to our surprise, the town is substantially cleaner, feels much safer, the malecon is beautiful and the south beach is incredible. We found restaurants and bars that were very nice; as well as, easy in easy out taco stands. After 7 nights, we were not ready to leave. We found San Felipe a very nice experience and will go back soon. Too bad there is not an easy way to travel to the area. San Felipe is clearly not for everyone but I would encourage a stay if you are in the area.

340827060.name: Small town 2 Hours away from Mexicali
340827060.author: a TripAdvisor user
340827060.reviewBody: Though is small town I honestly like the tranquility of this place.  The color of the water in "mar of cortez" is just beautiful.  Granted that is a small town, Good Places are hard to fine but they exist I found one excellent place but a little price $250.00 dlls per night for a 2 bedroom Condo.  However, in February when the Baja race starts the weather starts to get much better and the beaches get crowded.   \n\nAgain is a quiet beach town.  The best place to eat will be in the Malecon at Gueros restaurant where you can eat the catch of the day for less than 20 us dlls

338786984.name: Unwind
338786984.author: a TripAdvisor user
338786984.reviewBody:
Went for long walks on the endless beach and into the village.
The shrimp and fish are world class as good as anything you could find anywhere in the world.

244556431.name: Not the "South Beach"
244556431.author: a TripAdvisor user
244556431.reviewBody: This is not the"South Beach"of Miami, Florida, as one (drunk?) poster seems to think! Rather, it\'s a beautiful beach in San Felipe, Mexico.

242825987.name: Watch out here or you\'ll get robbed!
242825987.author: a TripAdvisor user
242825987.reviewBody: If you go anywhere in the South Beach area, make sure you lock your car and belongings in a safe. Don\'t leave anything valuable in your room, including passports, money, camera equipment, computers, anything. You\'ll get robbed as soon as you turn your back. Sorry, this place used to be nice, but now everyone is robbing everyone else, especially during the holiday season.\n\nIf you\'re thinking of spending Christmas here, don\'t. Go to the Valle de Guadalupe or Rosarito Beach instead. You\'ll have a much better time and it\'s safer at these places. Even Ensenada is a better choice than San Felipe.

210317986.name: San Felipe Partying and Fishing...
210317986.author: a TripAdvisor user
210317986.reviewBody: First off, it was hellava drive down there, but once you checked into your vacation home, had a cocktail or 2, it was time to party with the locals! My friends and I had an amazing time there. From catching so many fish, to seeing everyone driving ATV\'s and Sandrails, it is a place to party and have difference kinds of fun with your loved ones!!! I recommend EVERYONE at least go to experience the love you receive from locals!!! I\'ll post pics soon...

204891392.name: beautiful nature
204891392.author: a TripAdvisor user
204891392.reviewBody: the land above the beach rises on sand cliffs that have been eroded in wonderous ways.  the tide goes way out leaving tidepools that are warm and filled with life.  when you go in the water, scuff the bottom, stirring up the sand, so that you don\'t surprise a stingray or jellyfish.  but watch for crabs too!  and then the dolphins showed up and put on a show for us.  Pelicans flew overhead and eventually the truck came driving down the beach to sell us some fresh pineapple and coconuts drinks.

139275908.name: I LOVE SAN FELIPE
139275908.author: a TripAdvisor user
139275908.reviewBody: Ii allways love san felipe since i remember my dad  use to take us there iwas bearly like 7 or 8 years old i had an uncle that lived there and work at the el cortez hotel 43 years ago and i allways go back on the time we use to go every year \neverything was nice i had to go to the thermal water  cause are very helpfuul for  bones

130892763.name: fiesta en el malecon
130892763.author: a TripAdvisor user
130892763.reviewBody: we walked around and ended up stoping towards the end of the malecon. we rented one of those moving DJ and had a party on the sidewalk...people driving around clapped and cheered with the music...it was awesome!!!
